item.title: Astro Bot Sells 1.5 Million Units 2 Months After Launch
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/astro-bot-million-units/

Sony has announced that the PlayStation-exclusive Astro Bot has sold 1.5 million units in its first two months.

The news came via the company’s Q2 earnings results, which revealed that Astro Bot sold 1.5 million units as of November 3, putting the number just shy of two months from its September 6, 2024 release date.

Astro Bot received universal acclaim on review aggregator Metacritic, with the game receiving a 94 out of 100 according to 138 reviews. Users also felt the same way, giving the game a 9.3 out of 10. Its universal acclaim has put the game at the forefront of being a likely winner for this years Game of The Year at The Game Awards, which takes place in December 2024.

Whether 1.5 million units sold is where Team Asobi and PlayStation hoped the game would be, remains to be seen, as either has yet to comment.

Nonetheless, Team Asobi has continued to support the game post-launch, offering weekly speedrun levels and new bots to collect.

Astro Bot released on September 6, 2024 exclusively on the PlayStation 5.

What do you think of Astro Bot selling 1.5 million units in its first two months? Do you think its impressive or do you think it could have done better? Join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming Forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out the latest on the Hogwarts Legacy sequel from Warner Bros. Games. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Macaulay Culkin Joins Cast of Fallout Season 2 As a ‘Crazy Genius’
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/macaulay-culkin-joins-cast-fallout-season-2/

Following the immense success of the live-action Fallout television series, thanks to Amazon Prime, it was only a matter of time before the series’ second season started attracting more high-profile names. Of course, season one ended on a cliffhanger, so we’re all beyond excited to dive in for more, and now we have a tidbit of information to run with. According to a recent report, Macaulay Culkin joins the cast of Fallout season two, apparently playing a ‘crazy genius-type’ character. I’m a little curious about the role, and something in me thinks his part involves the Enclave.

In the original report published by Deadline, Macaulay Culkin’s role in the television series based on the long-popular role-playing game franchise remains relatively new. The only information we have about his performance is that he’s a crazy genius of some sort.

That said, Culkin joins a large and growing roster of exceptional stars, including:

  • Ella Purnell
  • Walton Goggins
  • Aaron Moten
  • Kyle MacLachlan
  • Xelia Mendes-Jones

Following the overwhelming reception to the first season, which debuted as one of Prime Video’s Top 3 most-watched series and received 16 Emmy nominations, a second season was almost immediately greenlit for production. While it’s still a ways off, filming begins shortly.

What did you think of the first season of Fallout? Let us know your thoughts on the show, along with the hopes for the second season, down in the comments! Don’t forget to visit the community forum to find like-minded Fallout fans!

On the topic of Fallout, did you hear we’ll soon be able to play as a Ghoul in Fallout 76? I’ll definitely roll a new character for the chance!

Subscribe to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.
